Comment: Columbus is one of those things where Trump and the SJW’s are both engaging in zero-sum “I can only win if you lose” thinking.   Columbus’s voyage was, unequivocally, a pivotal moment in world history. In European history. In American history. Putting the voyage in a historical context, it marks one of the most significant turning points in human history.   That’s worth knowing about, that’s worth remembering. It’s worth understanding how we got here. Where it began. What followed after.   It’s also worth knowing about the European guns, germs, and steel that followed. That decimated and, in many cases, completely wiped out indigenous American civilizations. It’s worth learning about those civilizations, their cultures, and their contributions to history.   Both things are true.   Remembering that voyage and the temerity and seamanship it took to make it is ok.   Remembering that Europeans discovering the Americas proved tragic for the people already living there, and that humanity lost entire civilizations in the decades and centuries that followed is also ok.   Both things should be happening. Both things should be in the history books.   Saying that all that matters is Columbus, those three ships, and his crew is not the full picture.   Nor is it the full picture to say that Columbus, those three ships, and his crew are the ones responsible for everything that followed. The Spanish, the Portuguese, the French, the Dutch, the British, and all of those monarchies, chased fortunes and each other. The Church chased converts. Many decisions were made following the discovery of the new world. All of that history is worth knowing learning about as well.   I digress, but it isn’t zero sum. You learn about the entirety of the history. You learn about the voyage of Colombus, you learn about the indigenous American civilizations and cultures. We shouldn’t be seeking to learn about one and not the other.   And back to the politics of it… the reason trump identifies things like this to attack is because it’s the same zero sum purity testing nonsense that he wants to engage in. It’s the nourishment for his politics. Given that, I especially hate to see this particular issue pop up in the news.
